event_data.continuation_prompt:
The conductor singleton pattern implementation is complete and integrated. Cycle 3 should focus on PRODUCTION VALIDATION and DOCUMENTATION:

1. **Live System Validation**:
   - Start the dashboard and verify conductor API endpoints work: GET /api/conductor/status, GET /api/conductor/metrics, GET /api/conductor/collisions
   - Start a test conductor and verify the dashboard shows it as running
   - Test the --check-status CLI flag: python3 atlasforge_conductor.py --check-status
   - Test blocked startup when conductor already running
   - Test --takeover flag gracefully restarts conductor
   - Verify metrics are written to logs/conductor_lock_metrics.jsonl

2. **Dashboard UI Enhancement** (Optional):
   - Add a conductor status widget to the main dashboard showing: running/not running, PID, current mission, uptime
   - Add a 'Restart Conductor' button that calls POST /api/conductor/takeover
   - Display collision count from metrics

3. **Documentation**:
   - Write final mission report documenting the complete implementation
   - Update HANDOFF.md if context is running low
   - Document the new CLI flags (--takeover, --force-takeover, --check-status)

Files to reference:
- /home/vader/AI-AtlasForge/atlasforge_conductor.py (integrated)
- /home/vader/AI-AtlasForge/dashboard_v2.py (integrated)
- /home/vader/AI-AtlasForge/workspace/ConductorTakeover/conductor_dashboard_api.py (API endpoints)
- /home/vader/AI-AtlasForge/workspace/ConductorTakeover/artifacts/test_results.md (93 tests passing)

cycle_report.summary: Cycle 2 completed the full integration of the conductor singleton implementation into the production AtlasForge system. All 93 tests pass (100% success rate) across unit, functional, adversarial, property-based, and integration testing categories. The enhanced lock management is now live in atlasforge_conductor.py with dashboard API endpoints available via conductor_bp blueprint.
achievements: Added is_shutdown_requested() check in main loop (line 1101)
Created conductor_integration.py with drop-in replacement functions (525 lines)
Added 33 adversarial security tests - all pass with 0 vulnerabilities
Added 9 property-based invariant tests - all properties hold
Added 8 integration tests verifying end-to-end functionality
All 93 tests pass with 100% success rate
Backward compatibility verified - legacy PID-only lock format supported
